se2.e.utilities

Class Vector2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • se2.e.utilities.Vector2D

  • public class Vector2D
extends java.lang.Object
    Convienience class for representing vectors in the plane. The vector supports both cartesian and polar coordinates. This class can be optimized on performance by saving the length and angle properties as well.
    Author:
    Anders Kalhauge

             double length)
        Create a new 2D vector from polar coordinates.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle of the vector in radians.
        length - The length of the vector.
        Returns:
        The new 2D vector.

      • zero

        public static Vector2D zero()

      • add

        public static Vector2D add(Vector2D a,
           Vector2D b)
        Create a new 2D vector as the sum of two other 2D vectors. The two addend vectors (a and b) will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        a - first addend vector.
        b - second addend vector.
        Returns:
        sum vector of a and b.

      • subtract

        public static Vector2D subtract(Vector2D a,
                Vector2D b)
        Create a new 2D vector as the difference between two other 2D vectors. The minuend and subtrahend vectors (a and b) will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        a - minuend vector
        b - subtrahend vector
        Returns:
        difference vector of a and b

      • add

        public Vector2D add(Vector2D other)
        Add another 2D vector to this vector. The other vector will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        other - vector to add.
        Returns:
        this vector after addition.

      • factorAdd

        public Vector2D factorAdd(double factor,
                 Vector2D addend)
        Add another 2D vector sized a factor. This method is ment for vector polynominals. The addend vector will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to multiply the addend vector with befor addition.
        addend - vector to add.
        Returns:
        this vector after the factorized add.

      • longerThan

        public boolean longerThan(double distance)
        Calculates whether this vector is longer than a given distance. Use this method in stead of getLength() when possible, while it is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to compare with.
        Returns:
        whether the length of this vector is longer than the given distance.
